content.description: good looking wide crack right of detached flake/pillar.
content.protection: up to #4,  possibly smaller to midsize gear inside the wide...?

content.description: Technical, small right facing corner. Boulder up to first bolt, mantel onto a ledge, friction climb up to the second clip. Find the stance to place a blue and black alien nest before rocking out left to the third bolt. Reachy moves to a finger crack (optional .5), crank over and onto the ledge above with good holds heading up and left to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Ten feet right of wide crack, where the trail meets the cliff.

content.description: Clip the white hanger, place a piece or two (finger size/nut) continue up to a right facing corner, turn the corner out left, clip two more bolts (crux). At this point you are at the split of "Setting Sail" and "Mizzen Sail". Fiddle in a few r.p.'s at the bottom of the seam, then head out left to the shallow right facing corner system. The climb travels up and right to a two bolt anchor shared with Mizzen Sail.
content.protection: Small rack of nuts with brass and larger size rack of nuts. maybe a couple finger size cams for training weight.
content.location: A hundred feet or so up slope and right, from where the trail meets the cliff. Look up for right facing corner/ramps twenty feet left of the black scoop of rock .

content.description: A whole bunch of great climbing that does'nt let up until the end.
content.protection: standard rack, double up fingers and .75
content.location: Upslope and right of where the trail meets the cliff on the east side.obvious snaking crack system off the ground that skirts the right side of a massive left facing corner.

content.description: A great mixed line! scramble up cracks to a ledge. Gear protects up to the first bolt. Layback and balance up cracks and grooves to a techy sequence at the last bolt.
content.protection: Single rack and bolts. Bolted anchor
content.location: Around the corner to the right of static free. About 20 feet right of Magalloway. The start follows cracks behind a tree and leads to a bolted face above

content.description: A full length sport climb on top of a full length trad climb. Climb steep blocks to a right facing layback crack. Exit the crack to bolts trending left through excellent quartz face climbing. A long and varied pitch.
content.protection: Standard rack with plenty of extendables. Bolted anchor on top
content.location: Around the corner just right of static free

content.description: Little bit of slab (bolt), to some hand crack, into some steep thumb press, foot matching, palm balance traverse, stepping right to layback movement (crux). Continue through the quartz headwall to the chains. Can be done as one long pitch off of "static free" or the offwidth from the ground, just sling long. Bring a 70 meter to this cliff!
content.location: Directly above the Static Free anchor.

content.description: 5.9 climbing on either side of the flake(sharp). my guess is follow the weakness or cracks off to the right after toping out the flake...
content.location: Where the approach trail meets the cliff.

content.description: Was out with Ray Rice and he fixed a fuzzy red static line Randy Baker had stashed on an old project. I rope soloed up and found myself wandering into the traversing quartz dike to the right of the project. Mellow chunky quartz climbing from the base of the cliff leads to a steep crux pulling on quartz edges. I would recommend a 70m rope unless someone is following. The FA was done from the ground, but the belayer should stand at the birch tree by the first bolt and can pre clip it for the leader. Will return next season to clean it up more, but all key holds are clear. Good warmup for the area
content.protection: 10 bolts (1 perma at crux for cleaning) + Lower Offs, maybe a long draw or two to reduce rope drag
content.location: From the top of the new approach trail (flagged blue) head right up the steep hill for a couple hundred feet to the base of a quartz gully. This is on the slab face to the left of Polar Star.

content.description: Finger bending, head scratching, toes screaming, goodness!Beeline it to the sexy seam, that scratches its way through the black/chocolate scoop of deliciousness...
content.protection: r.p.'s and brass between third and fourth bolt
content.location: 100' upslope and right of where the trail meets the cliff. first bolt is white and ten feet up between two trees.

content.description: The East Side is the section of cliff right of the Friction Slabs.  Climbs can be up to 100 feet with several cracks.
